snippet: An ambitious and worldly middle class is increasingly unwilling to tolerate the constraints of a Mao-era bureaucracy that dictates how people can live.
abstract: Members of China's middle class, increasingly worldly, are growing impatient with outsized bureaucracy and red tape that characterizes Communist Party's hold on their lives.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: An ambitious and worldly middle class is increasingly unwilling to tolerate the constraints of a Mao-era bureaucracy that dictates how people can live.

headline.main: China’s Middle Class Chafes Against Maze of Red Tape
headline.print_headline: China’s Middle Class Chafes Against Maze of Red Tape
